name: Conan O'Brian
monologue: The Middle East has their own Charlie Sheen right now: Moammar Gadhafi.

name: Conan O'Brian
monologue: They’re saying Gadhafi is “disconnected from reality.” According to the State Department, Gadhafi thought this year’s Oscars were fantastic.

name: Conan O'Brian
monologue: New Hampshire is debating a bill to classify some airport screenings as sexual assault. California is debating a bill that would classify those same screenings as “doing what you need to do to get the part.”

name: Conan O'Brian
monologue: Christina Aguilera was arrested for public intoxication. Police knew she was drunk because she got all the words to the national anthem right.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Christina Aguilera was arrested for public intoxication. I don’t know if she was disoriented or what, but she demanded to go back on the set of “Two and a Half Men.”

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Charlie Sheen said that you can’t compare him to other people because he has “tiger blood.” Then Tiger Woods said, “I have Charlie Sheen blood.”

name: Jay Leno
monologue: It was really cool at the Oscars when they made it appear as if Bob Hope was alive. That’s the same technology they’ll use at Hugh Hefner’s wedding.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: A federal watchdog agency says that overlapping and duplicate programs waste billions of dollars each year. Congress is taking this study so seriously that they’re ordering a second study to look into it.

name: Craig Ferguson
monologue: Happy birthday to Kmart. And as always, thank you for the awesome suits.

name: Craig Ferguson
monologue: Christina Aguilera was arrested for public intoxication. Is that really a crime?

name: Craig Ferguson
monologue: Apparently Aguilera was stumbling and incoherent, which makes her perfect to host next year’s Oscars.

name: Craig Ferguson
monologue: Anne Hathaway says she was paid $750,000 to wear a Tiffany diamond necklace to the Oscars. Lindsay Lohan said, “You can do that?”

name: David Letterman
monologue: My name is Dave Letterman. I’m hooked on a drug called “Dave Letterman.”

name: David Letterman
monologue: Top Ten Surprises in Moammar Gadhafi’s First United States Interview

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: On Piers Morgan’s show, Charlie Sheen brought out a drug test to prove that he’s clean. Then he answered some questions to prove that he’s not.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Happy 17th birthday to Justin Bieber. He’s finally old enough for his parents to move out of his house.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Bristol Palin is releasing a book called “Not Afraid of Life.” Meanwhile, Sarah Palin is releasing a book called, “I’m Afraid of Books.”

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: A company in Massachusetts is building a robotic cheetah. If I wanted a cat with the personality of a robot, I’d just get a cat.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Welcome to the only show in America not featuring Charlie Sheen.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Happy National Pancake Day. This is why our country is so fat.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: It’s also Justin Bieber’s birthday. On this day in 1994, Mama Bieber had a “baby, baby, baby.”

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: I’ve been tracking Hurricane Charlie Sheen. He’s making Mel Gibson look like Debbie Gibson.
